gurmukhi: hir nwcq nwcq gÍwrn mY his cMdRBgw hU kI Er inhwrXo ] soaU hsI ieq qy ey hsy jdurw iqh so bcnw hY aucwrXo ]
transliteration: Daar(i) Naachat Naachat Gvaaran Mai Has(i) Channdrabhagad Hoo Kior Nihdaryo|| Sooo Hasiit Te E Hase Jaduraa Tih So Bachnaa Hai Ouchdaryo||
translation: During his dance, Krishna saw smilingly towards Chandarbhaga; she laughed from this side and from that side Krishna began to talk smilingly with her;

gurmukhi: myro mhw ihq hY qum so biRKBwn suqw ieh hyr ibcwrXo ] Awn qIXw sMg hyq krXo hm aUpir qy hir hyq ibswrXo ]674]
transliteration: Mero Mahaa Hit Hai Toum So Brikhbhaan Soutaa Eh Her Bichdaryo|| Oon Teeyaa San Het Daryo Ham Oopar(i) Te Har(i) Het Bisdaryo||674||
translation: Seeing this Radha thought that Krishna was then absorbed in love with another woman and as such his love with her had ended.674.

gurmukhi: hir rwiDkw Awnn dyKq hI Apny mn mY ieh BwNq aucwrXo ] sXwm Bey bis Aaur qRIXw iqh qy Aiq pY mnsw nhI DwrXo ]
transliteration: Har(i) Raadhikaa Aanan Dekhat Hiapne Man Mai Eh Bhaant Ouchdaryo|| Syaam Bhae Bas(i) Aur Treeyaa Tih Te At(i) Pai Mansaa Nahidhdaryo||
translation: Seeing the face of Krishna, Radha said in her own mind, “Krishna has now been subdued by other women; therefore he does not remember me now with his heart;”

gurmukhi: AwnMd Qo ijqno mn mY iqqno ieh BwK ibdw kir fwrXo ] cMdRBgw muK cMdu duqY sB gÍwrin qy Gt moih ibcwrXo ]675]
transliteration: Oonand Tho Jitno Man Mai Titno Eh Bhaakh Bidaa Kar(i) Daro|| Channdrabhagad Moukh Channd(u) Doutai Sabh Gvaaran(i) Te Ghat Moh(i) Bichdaryo||675||
translation: Saying this, she bade farewell to bliss from her mind; she thought that the face of Chandarbhaga is like moon for Krishna and he loves her the least out of all the gopis.675.

gurmukhi: kih kY ieh BwNq soaU qb hI Apny mn mY ieh bwq ibcwrI ] pRIq krI hir Awnih so qij Kyl sBY auT Dwm isDwrI ]
transliteration: Kah(i) Kai Eh Bhaant Sooo Tab Hiapne Man Mai Eh Baat Bichdaree|| Preet Karihar(i) So Taj(i) Khel Sabhai Outh Dhaan Sidhdaree||
translation: Saying thus, she ruminated in her mind and thinking that Krishna then loved someone else, she started for her home;

gurmukhi: AYis krI gnqI mn mY aupmw iqh kI kib sXwm aucwrI ] qRIXn bIc clYgI kQw biRKBwn suqw biRjnwQ ibswrI ]676]
transliteration: Ais(i) Karigadtiman Mai Oupmaa Tih Kikabi Syaam Ouchdaree|| Treeyan Beech Chalai-gikathaa Brikhbhaan Soutaa Brijnaath Bisdaree||676||
translation: The poet Shyam says, “Now it will be talked among women that Krishna has forgotton Radha.”676.
Now begins the description of the honouring of Radha

gurmukhi: ieh BwNq clI kih kY su qiRXw kib sXwm khY soaU kuMj glI hY ] cMd muKI qn kMcn ky sm gÍwrn qy joaU KUb BlI hY ]
transliteration: Eh Bhaant Chalikah(i) Kai Su Triyaa Kabi Syaam Kahai Sooo Kounj Gadihai|| Channd Moukhitan Kanchanndke Sam Gvaaran Te Jooo Khoob Bhalihai||
translation: Saying thus, Radha is leaving the alcove; Radha, the most beautiful amongst the gopis has the face like moon and the body like gold;

gurmukhi: mwn kIXo inKrI iqn qy miRgnI sI mno su ibnw hI AlI hY ] XyN aupjI aupmw mn mY piq so riq mwnhu rUT clI hY ]677]
transliteration: Maan Keeyo Nikhritin Te Mrigadisimano Su Binaa Hialihai|| Yon Oupjioupmaa Man Mai Pat(i) So Rat(i) Maanoh Rooth Chalihai||677||
translation: Having been proud, she now was separated from her friends like a doe from the herd of does; on seeing her, it seemed that Rati, being angry with the god of love, was leaving him.677.

gurmukhi: ieq qy hir Kylq rws ibKY biRKBwn suqw kir pRIq inhwrI ] pyK rhXo n ipKI iqn mY kib sXwm khY ju huqI soaU pXwrI ]
transliteration: It Te Har(i) Khelat Raas Bikhai Brikhbhaan Soutaa Kar(i) Preet Nihdaree|| Pekh Rahyo Na Pikhitin Mai Kabi Syaam Kahai Ju Houtisooo Pydaree||
translation: On this side, Krishna, absorbed in the amorous play, looked towards Radha, but she was nowhere to be seen;
